NGINX é…ç½®æ¸…å•

ä»¥ä¸‹å†…å®¹æ¥è‡ª SimulatedGREG/nginx-cheatsheetã€‚

é€šç”¨è®¾ç½®

ç«¯å£ listen

server {
  # standard HTTP protocol
  listen 80;
  
  # standard HTTPS protocol
  listen 443 ssl;
  
  # listen on 80 using IPv6
  listen [::]:80;
  
  # listen only on IPv6
  listen [::]:80 ipv6only=on;
}

åŸŸå server_name

server {
  # Listen to yourdomain.com
  server_name yourdomain.com;
  
  # Listen to multiple domains
  server_name yourdomain.com www.yourdomain.com;
  
  # Listen to all sub-domains
  server_name *.yourdomain.com;
  
  # Listen to all top-level domains
  server_name yourdomain.*;
  
  # Listen to unspecified hostnames (listens to IP address itself)
  server_name "";
}

è®¿é—®æ—¥å¿— access_log

server {
  # Relative or full path to log file
  access_log /path/to/file.log;
  
  # Turn 'on' or 'off'
  access_log on;
}

gzip, client_max_body_size

server {
  # Turn gzip compression 'on' or 'off'
  gzip on;
  
  # Limit client body size to 10mb
  client_max_body_size 10M;
}

å“åº”æ–‡ä»¶

é™æ€æ–‡ä»¶

server {
  listen 80;
  server_name yourdomain.com;
  
  location / {
  	root /path/to/website;
  }
}

æ”¯æŒå‰ç«¯è·¯ç”±

server {
  listen 80;
  server_name yourdomain.com;
  root /path/to/website;
  
  location / {
  	try_files $uri $uri/ /index.html;
  }
}

é‡å®šå‘

301 æ°¸ä¹…é‡å®šå‘

ç”¨äºæ¯”å¦‚ www.yourdomain.com é‡å®šå‘åˆ° yourdomain.com æˆ– å°† http é‡å®šå‘åˆ° httpsã€‚

server {
  listen 80;
  server_name www.yourdomain.com;
  return 301 http://yourdomain.com$request_uri;
}

302 ä¸´æ—¶é‡å®šå‘

server {
  listen 80;
  server_name yourdomain.com;
  return 302 http://otherdomain.com;
}

é‡å®šå‘æŒ‡å®šé¡µé¢

server {
  listen 80;
  server_name yourdomain.com;
  
  location /redirect-url {
	return 301 http://otherdomain.com;  
  }
}

åå‘ä»£ç†

åŸºæœ¬

server {
  listen 80;
  server_name yourdomain.com;
  
  location / {
    proxy_pass http://0.0.0.0:3000;
    # where 0.0.0.0:3000 is your Node.js Server bound on 0.0.0.0 listing on port 3000
  }
}

è¿›é˜¶

upstream node_js {
  server 0.0.0.0:3000;
  # where 0.0.0.0:3000 is your Node.js Server bound on 0.0.0.0 listing on port 3000
}

server {
  listen 80;
  server_name yourdomain.com;
  
  location / {
    proxy_pass http://node_js;
  }
}

socket ç›¸å…³

upstream node_js {
  server 0.0.0.0:3000;
}

server {
  listen 80;
  server_name yourdomain.com;
  
  location / {
    proxy_pass http://node_js;
    proxy_redirect off;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
    proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
	
    # not required but useful for applications with heavy WebSocket usage
    # as it increases the default timeout configuration of 60
    proxy_read_timeout 80;
  }
}

TLS/SSL (HTTPS)

ä»¥ä¸‹ä»…æ˜¯ç®€å• HTTPS ç¤ºä¾‹ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸æ˜¯å¯ç”¨äºç”Ÿäº§ç¯å¢ƒçš„æœ€ä¼˜é…ç½®ã€‚

ç›¸å…³èµ„æºï¼š

  • å…è´¹è¯ä¹¦
  • Ubuntu ä¸Šé…ç½® TLS/SSL çš„æ•™ç¨‹
server {
  listen 443 ssl;
  server_name yourdomain.com;
  
  ssl on;
  
  ssl_certificate /path/to/cert.pem;
  ssl_certificate_key /path/to/privkey.pem;
  
  ssl_stapling on;
  ssl_stapling_verify on;
  ssl_trusted_certificate /path/to/fullchain.pem;

  ssl_protocols TLSv1 TLSv1.1 TLSv1.2;
  ssl_session_timeout 1d;
  ssl_session_cache shared:SSL:50m;
  add_header Strict-Transport-Security max-age=15768000;
}

# Permanent redirect for HTTP to HTTPS
server {
  listen 80;
  server_name yourdomain.com;
  return 301 https://$host$request_uri;
}

å¤§å‹åº”ç”¨

è´Ÿè½½å‡è¡¡

upstream node_js {
  server 0.0.0.0:3000;
  server 0.0.0.0:4000;
  server 123.131.121.122;
}

server {
  listen 80;
  server_name yourdomain.com;
  
  location / {
    proxy_pass http://node_js;
  }
}
